answers.answer: All of ur pregnancies have been with Chiari, u just know it now...I would suggest a C-section to avoid the strain of natural birth, which can cause the issues  and symptoms to flare.Talk with ur NS b4, and see just how ur chiari is affecting u at this point....what other related conditions u may have that may complicate things for u or the baby.Sleep apnea, ehlers-danlos in addition to knowing if u have a CSF obstruction or a syrinx, at this point is important.Recovery post op can take some of us longer as we can develop other related issues as a result of surgery...so, u will want to discuss all of this with ur Drs b4 moving forward with surgery or a pregnancy.

Thanks so much for your input! We've been tossing the idea of baby #3 around for a while now and just couldn't decide. I will put it on the back burner for now til I get in to see a doc about everything going on with me before we decide for sure. :)

I want to say how thankful I am that you were blessed with two beatiful daughters, but I'm also happy to hear you will wait until you talk to your NS.  They will know what is best for you.  I wish you the best in this journey and I pray for brighter more pain free days for you.Linda :)

Thanks so much <3 It was a tough decision, especially when my hubby really wants another one. He's just not the one that has to be pregnant and deliver a baby while dealing with the horrible symptoms I deal with on a daily basis. I don't think he truly understands what I go through. I appreciate you all's support, it makes it easier for me to do what is best for me even though it isn't what I would do if I were 'normal'. It is so hard sometimes to deal with being sick all the time. I hate my chiari and the way it is controlling my life :(
ive been told by two different chiari doctors that the strain of carrying a child as well as delivering a child isnt good for us but idk just what ive been toldmolly

Molly, I would have to think that is relative to what may be going on with the individual too......Knowing I had chiari b4 I had my DD and knowing how I was after, I am sure it did not help, but I made it thru ok...and back then no one had  an idea I had it....not sure I could have managed more then the one I was blessed with, even tho I wanted more...lol....we all have to also know our limitations....looking back,  I was given what I could handle....I do feel it is best now that she knows to talk at length with both her NS and the OBGYN to see how they feel she will do....and she will have to talk with her DH, as  she will not know if this may cause her to be less able to handle the kids as much and he may have to step up.....But I do find ti interesting that u had 2 drs say carrying may be as detrimental as delivery for us...as I always wondered about that aspect....the nurse that writes articles on chiari and pregnant did not mention that as an issue in ne I have read so far....thanks for sharing that: )

im sure it deff has to do with the individual and probably syringo has a lot to do with it would be my guess. personally ive always wanted to adopt kids and now thats deff the way i will go but i no thats not the right choice for everyone.molly
That is  a great idea to do regardless of health issues....u r one amazing young lady Miss Molly !!!

thank u selma but im not lol it was something that ive always wanted to do and now it just makes it that much more easier! also ive heard that the mother passes chiari on? i dnt no if thats true or not but i dnt want to pass chiari on at all!molly

I know there is still research on that and I really feel I got chiari from my dad, not my mom....so, it may not be u to pass it on,,...and for now my DD does not show ne signs at all....Some with chiari do have kids with it....but again, it can come from the dad as well.And in MHO...yes u r : P

Your question makes me feel so anxious, because we're playing Russian roulette with ourselves, untreated with Chiari--except with several bullets in the chamber!  I am shocked at how rapidly I declined in the last 6 months, and even more rapidly in the last few weeks.  As bad as you feel now, it can get worse, much worse.  Some days i was barely able to take care of my pets.  Maybe if you preserve your health now, you can delay surgery when your children are much older.Chiari can mess up your hormones too-- a friend started menstrating again after 10 yr of menopause, at 57!   Maybe it had something to do w/the miscarriages.Vivian

question: So I am wondering if getting pregnant with a chiari malformation (pre-op) is dangerous? I have four miscarriages (that I know of) before I conceived my daughter Gracelon in August 2007, I had some complications with her and was on bedrest for almost the entire pregnancy and ended up with preeclampsia with her as well. She was a pitocin/epidural vag. delivery with no complications really. I was then told I'd be lucky to get pregnant again without medical help because it had been so hard to get Gracie. So we counted ourselves blessed and didn't think about whether we would have more or not cause we were just so happy to have her. (On a side note I had worse symptoms from my unknown at the time Chiari after her delivery, the first time I really started to think I might have MS) Then in January 2010 we very unexpectedly conceived our second daughter Kaylee. I had some complications with her in the first trimester, about 13 weeks I had a severe bleeding spell like water breaking but not...it was tacked up to a low lying placenta, I was put on bedrest and pelvic rest till 20 weeks. At that check-up they did another ultrasound and found that the placenta had moved up and she was thriving. I ended up firing two OB's and hired a midwife and had my daughter in the comfort of my home on Sept. 25, 2010. Right after her birth I relapsed into the worst symptoms I've ever experienced! I couldn't even handle breastfeeding her because it was literally killing me. I couldn't move or function until I stopped nursing her and switched to formula...then I was able to move some without feeling like death was knocking on my door. So in December 2010 I gave in and went to see a doctor for my symptoms that I thought was maybe MS, I was referred to a NL and he did a CT scan to rule out a tumor and MS....I found out recently he should have done an MRI but that's in the past and I can't go back and make him do one lol. So he tacked my symptoms up to Fibromyalgia and I quit seeing him because I felt the dx was a cop out. So I was due for another brain scan this past December but didn't get it due to lack of $ and insurance. After the minor car accident in February I asked my chiropractor to order a scan for peace of mind. He had an MRI done on me on March 22 and that is when I found out about my CM.Sorry for all that, just wanted to give you some background to my history. Now on to the point of this post. I haven't been to see a NS or NL since finding out I have a CM. I have pretty severe symptoms on most days...sometimes I am lucky and have some pretty nice days here and there. My husband really wants another baby, our girls are 4 (May 17) and 19 months (will be 2 the end of Sept.). I don't mind either way...I am really on the fence about it even without the chiari being considered. I am happy with my little girls and wouldn't mind having just them. On the other hand I wouldn't mind having one more (but that would be it! I'm done at three lol). Now I just sent my MRI to a NS in Michigan and awaiting her opinion on my scan. I'm truly hoping she will give me some kind of answer on what I can do to stop these horrible symptoms. Who knows...she may say I should have the surgery soon or she may say I don't need it at this time. I can't say for sure. My question is...should we try for another baby now or wait or what? I've told my husband we need to wait, but then at the same time I kind of want to try for one more. I just don't know what to do and I guess I am just wanting you all's opinion on the matter.I am so so sorry this is so long, this is just something we've been debating on for a while now. Thanks for any input/advice on this delicate matter. :)
title: Pregnancy and Chiari
